pull.title: qa: Remove race between connecting and shutdown on separate connections
pull.body:
Fixes the error https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14670#issuecomment-447255352 reported by @ken2812221.

There is a race between RPC stop and another concurrent call in the test framework. The connection must be established and the command `waitfornewblock` running before calling `stop`.

See also https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14670#issuecomment-447304513.

rename.from: qa: Remove race between conneting and shutdown on separate connections
rename.to: qa: Remove race between connecting and shutdown on separate connections

events.message: qa: Remove race between connecting and shutdown on separate connections

events.body:
utACK 4412a59bfe8228698e5b5bbe8bb21c8e8a70d357
No difference with 49a79d4 except for commit msg.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,7 +22,10 @@ def set_test_params(self):
 
     def run_test(self):
         node = get_rpc_proxy(self.nodes[0].url, 1, timeout=600, coveragedir=self.nodes[0].coverage_dir)
+        # force connection establishment
+        node.getblockcount()
         Thread(target=test_long_call, args=(node,)).start()
+        sleep(1)
comments.body: I don't like hardcoding a second of sleep here, hardly seems robust.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,7 +22,10 @@ def set_test_params(self):
 
     def run_test(self):
         node = get_rpc_proxy(self.nodes[0].url, 1, timeout=600, coveragedir=self.nodes[0].coverage_dir)
+        # force connection establishment
+        node.getblockcount()
         Thread(target=test_long_call, args=(node,)).start()
+        sleep(1)
comments.body:
Agree, this should be replaced by something like:
```py
wait_until(lambda: self.getrpcinfo()['active_workers'] > 1)
```
Other suggestions?
Consider this approach temporary, just for concept ack.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,8 +20,14 @@ def set_test_params(self):
 
     def run_test(self):
         node = get_rpc_proxy(self.nodes[0].url, 1, timeout=600, coveragedir=self.nodes[0].coverage_dir)
+        # Force connection establishment by executing a dummy command.
+        node.getblockcount()
comments.body: Is this required given that we wait anyway until node.waitfornewblock is called, which in turn should set up the connection?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,8 +20,14 @@ def set_test_params(self):
 
     def run_test(self):
         node = get_rpc_proxy(self.nodes[0].url, 1, timeout=600, coveragedir=self.nodes[0].coverage_dir)
+        # Force connection establishment by executing a dummy command.
+        node.getblockcount()
comments.body: For the test to pass this is not required, but this is here to note that there's still a race after connection establishment. Let me know if it's not important.
